ratings.comment: Ugh. Really boring lecturer, especially when paired with the fact that Pupa Gilbert teaches the prior half of the semester. She never did anything to gain the attention of the class and I think a lot of people fell off due to her mediocre teaching style. At least she's nice.

She made absolutely no sense the entire second half of the semester. I missed Pupa the entire time. If you can teach yourself the material through labs and YouTube videos, I 100% recommend that over her lectures.
I think Carrie is a good professor although sometimes I couldn't hear her clearly. But she will try to let the whole class follow her. The midterms are easy. Highly recommended.

She's a nice person but her lectures are genuinely the most boring lectures I've ever experienced. They're so monotone and confusing and she posts the slides online but writes down notes that aren't on the slides so I feel like I have to go to lecture to get everything I need to know. If it wasn't for those extra notes I would skip every lecture.

The lectures were very boring and her explanations were very confusing. I would try to avoid her as a lecturer. The exams were not too difficult but I needed to teach myself everything and ask the TA's most of the questions.

She was the most boring lecturer that I've encountered which made it difficult to pay attention. The second half of the semester she teaches is based around difficult/obscure homework assignments and midterms that feel like they are made to trick you and catch you off guard (I studied/prepared a decent amount for the exams and attended lectures)

She is very unenthusiastic and monotone, making lectures quite boring and hard to pay attention to. She is not a great lecturer or communicator. The class is graded off very few tests that are VERY hard and often do not reflect what has been taught during lecture or what has appeared on the review, same goes for the homework.
She was super nice but not a great teacher. Was pretty scattered when teaching and didn't teach with a lot of enthusiasm which made it hard to pay attention.
